instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3476-A cpu warm, no fan spin
threads.message:
Hi, I have a 820-3476-A which covered in flux, all the ppbus_s5 caps is shorted, and when I  remove f7040, the ppbus is still shorted
magsafe is green then orange light when plugged in, cpu does get warm, but no fan spin

threads.title: 820-3476-A cpu warm, no fan spin
threads.message: Which big coil has exact the same ohm value to ground as PPBUS_G3H?

threads.title: 820-3476-A cpu warm, no fan spin
threads.message: Sounds like some moron killed the CPU by being stupid. This I would advise not wasting time on

threads.title: 820-3476-A cpu warm, no fan spin
threads.message: it takes little time to confirm a dead CPU.  Do some quick resistance checks on VCORE and PCH power supplies.  I have fixed many boards that have been covered in flux by monkeys.
